algorithm_technique: Sort the array and use two pointers to find the maximum sum less than K.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest sum of two distinct numbers in an array that is less than a given value K.
problem_summary_technical: Given an array and an integer K, find max(nums[i] + nums[j]) such that i < j and nums[i] + nums[j] < K.
key_insights: Sorting the array is crucial for the two-pointer approach.
The two-pointer strategy efficiently explores pairs without redundant checks.
Maintaining the maximum valid sum found so far is key.
